name: Rocket's Sneak Attack

historicalClassification.note: Originally printed as a Trainer. Would be classified as Supporter by modern rules due to powerful hand disruption effect.

effect.text: Look at your opponent's hand. If he or she has any Trainer cards, choose 1 of them. Your opponent shuffles that card into his or her deck.

tips: Play early to see opponent's hand and remove key Trainers
Target Computer Search, Item Finder, or Professor Oak
Information gained from seeing hand is valuable even without Trainers

competitiveHistory: Rocket's Sneak Attack was one of the most powerful disruption cards from Team Rocket. Looking at the opponent's hand provided valuable information, and removing a key Trainer could derail their strategy. It was especially devastating against combo decks relying on specific Trainer cards. Many competitive decks ran multiple copies for consistent early disruption.

rulings.ruling: You must show your opponent which card you chose before they shuffle it into their deck.
If your opponent has no Trainer cards in hand, you still get to look at their hand.
The opponent shuffles the chosen Trainer into their deck, not discard pile.
